subject: Aptitude Test || Campus Placement FY25-26 || Charusat
snippet: Dear Students, I hope this email finds you well. Thank you for attending our presentation today. We are excited to proceed with the next step in our recruitment process. Here are the details for the
content:
Dear Students,

I hope this email finds you well. 

Thank you for attending our presentation today. We are excited to proceed
with the next step in our recruitment process.

Here are the details for the aptitude test:

Please find your test link: Aptitude Test
<https://www.flexiquiz.com/SC/N/569c768b-161c-4de5-af3d-b3f15ed89632>  

Time Duration: 45 mins

Kindly ensure that you:

*	Have a stable internet connection.
*	Find a quiet place to take the test without interruptions.
*	Start the test promptly at your scheduled time.

Please complete the test within the allotted time. Once you have completed
the test, we will review your responses and share the results accordingly.

If you have any questions or encounter any issues, do not hesitate to reach
out to us.

Wishing you all the best!

Thanks & Regards,


 

 <https://o2h.com/> 

Shivangi Shukla 

Human Resource Executive, o2h group 

Seeding new ideas in life science, technology and green innovation

(M): +91 9664710922

 <https://o2h.com/about/> About |  <https://careers.o2h.com/> Careers |
<https://o2h.com/careers/culture-values/> Culture |
<mailto:shivangi.shukla@o2h.com> Email

 <http://bit.ly/LI-o2hgroup>    <http://bit.ly/Twitter_o2hgroup>
<http://bit.ly/FB_o2hgroup>    <https://bit.ly/3ecNWqK>

subject: Regarding Email Extraction.
snippet: This is a gentle reminder to please complete the email extraction process by 20th June 2025, so we can move forward with cleaning and preparing the dataset for training. As shared earlier, you'll
content:
This is a gentle reminder to please complete the email extraction process
by 20th June 2025, so we can move forward with cleaning and preparing the
dataset for training. As shared earlier, you’ll find the necessary script
and instruction video in the Google Drive folder.

If you’ve already completed the process, kindly ignore this message. If
not, we request you to complete it at your earliest convenience. Please
don’t hesitate to reach out if you face any difficulties—we're here to help!

Thank you once again for being part of this student-led research.

Warm regards,
Vansh Malani – 23DCS056
James Dhandhukiya – 23DCS023
Jugvi Desai – 23DCS021

subject: Re: Request for Email Data Contribution – Research Acknowledgment Included
snippet: Dear Student Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. We truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of our academic email classification model
content:
Dear Student

Thank you so much for your willingness to support our research project. We
truly appreciate your help in improving the accuracy and effectiveness of
our academic email classification model.

As promised, your data will be used strictly for academic purposes, and
only informational emails will be processed. Your contribution will also be
acknowledged in our final presentation/report.

To make the process simple, we’ve prepared a Google Drive folder containing:

A script that will extract only academic emails from your inbox.

A short instruction video explaining exactly how to run the script safely
and securely.

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1PbOQD_oKgAsZ9pWPrY62nWme5xyJr6JD?usp=sharing


The video is inside the same folder, titled “Email Extraction
Instructions.mp4”.


The link to provide the extracted emails is given below

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1NNd3t-VRDvEbDpGLDJOCsyBMA1t19Pdz?usp=sharing
Please go through the video before running the script. If you have any
doubts or face any issues at any step, feel free to reach out to us — we're
more than happy to help!

Once again, thank you for contributing to this student-led research
project. Your support means a lot to us!

Warm regards,
Vansh Malani – 23DCS056
James Dhandhukiya – 23DCS023
Jugvi Desai – 23DCS021

>> *Dear fellow student,*
>>
>> We hope you're doing well.
>>
>> We are a group of students working on a research project focused on
>> analyzing CHARUSAT student inbox data to train a machine learning model
>> that can automatically classify academic emails — such as faculty
>> announcements, seminar notifications, class updates, and internship
>> opportunities.
>>
>> We are reaching out to a few *handpicked students*, and we believe your
>> contribution could significantly strengthen the quality of our dataset. As
>> a token of appreciation, all contributors will be *acknowledged in our
>> final research presentation/report*.
>>
>> Please rest assured:
>>
>> ·       Your data will be used *strictly for academic and research
>>  purposes*.
>>
>> ·        We are only interested in academic/informational emails, *not
>> personal content*.
>>
>> ·        *No data will be collected without your clear consent*, and we
>> will *explain the data extraction process in detail* if you agree to
>> help.
>>
>> If you're willing to contribute or have any questions, feel free to reach
>> out. We truly appreciate your support in helping make this student-led
>> research a success!
>>
>> *Note:* Please reach out to us if you agree by 15th June 2025.
>>
>>
>>
>> Warm regards,
>>
>> Vansh Malani, 23DCS056

subject: Fwd: Campus Drive 2025 Announcement # Intuitive Cloud
content:
*Dear All,*

Please go through the trailing mail.

================================================================================================================

Hi Ashwin



Confirming the placement drive on 11th June. The online assessment will be
conducted on 7th June 2025.

Attaching the list of applicants received.



*Interview process*

   - Online test
   - Group discussion
   - Tech 1 interview
   - Tech 2 Interview
   - HR Round



*Please find the further details*

   - *Internship Duration:* 8–12 months (to meet the mandatory 8-month
   internship requirement)
   - *Mode:* Work From Office (WFO) – Ahmedabad
   - *Stipend:* ₹20,000/month
   - *Compensation (Post-internship Full-Time):*

BTech /MTech : ₹7 LPA + ₹2 LPA performance bonus



Note : Post completion of internship period, further assessment will be
conducted before converting them to full time employee.





Looking forward to making this campus placement a great success.









*Thanks & Regards*

subject: Task round- Interview Results – Agumentik Group Internship
snippet: Dear Students, We would like to inform you about the results of the interview process for the Agumentik Group internship opportunity. As per the company's feedback, none of the submitted tasks met
content:
Dear Students,
We would like to inform you about the results of the interview process for the Agumentik Group internship opportunity.
As per the company's feedback, none of the submitted tasks met the required quality standards, and it was observed that a significant number of submissions were copied or lacked originality. Due to this, no students have been selected at this stage.
However, the company has mentioned that they are still reviewing the submissions and may consider shortlisting a student if any profile stands out during the final evaluation. We will keep you informed if there are any updates or changes.
We encourage all students to treat such opportunities seriously and maintain originality and integrity in all assessments and tasks.
​Unfeigned Regards,

Nitin Tyagi
Senior Placement Manager
Edunet Foundation
Gurgaon/NCR office: 901 (9th floor)- Unitech Commercial Tower II, Sector 45, Greenwood City, Gurugram, Haryana, 122003
Call/ WhatsApp- 9997090317
LinkedIn- linkedin.com/in/nitin-tyagi-60263aba/<http://linkedin.com/in/nitin-tyagi-60263aba/>
Website- https://www.edunetfoundation.org/

P   Before printing, think about the environment, every 3000 A4 paper costs 1 tree. Please DO NOT print unless you really need it.

subject: Exciting Internship Opportunities
snippet: Dear Student, We are pleased to invite you to apply for internship at Racila Softech Pvt. Ltd., We are seeking enthusiastic and motivated individuals to join our team as interns in the following areas:
content:
Dear Student,

We are pleased to invite you to apply for internship at *Racila Softech
Pvt. Ltd.,* We are seeking enthusiastic and motivated individuals to join
our team as interns in the following areas:

   - *UI/UX Design*
   - *Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning (AI/ML)*
   - *Web development *– PHP/Wordpress/MERN Stack
   - *Android Development*

This is a fantastic opportunity to gain real-world experience, develop your
technical skills, and contribute to innovative projects. As an intern
at *Racila
Softech Pvt. Ltd.,* you will work alongside experienced professionals,
tackle challenging assignments, and help shape the future of our products
and services.

*Internship Details:*

   - *Duration:* 3 to 6 months
   - *Location:* Remote
   - *Stipend: *Pain/Unpaid (1st month unpaid then since 2nd month onwards
   paid)
   - *Deadline to Apply:* 7th June

If you are interested in any of these positions, please send your updated
resume and a brief cover letter to *internship@racilasoftech.com
<internship@racilasoftech.com>*

We look forward to receiving your application and potentially welcoming you
to the Racila Softech team!



Best regards,
Sonali
HR-recruiter
Racila Softech Pvt. Ltd.

internship@racilasoftech.com

wrote:

Sir,

As discussed, Please find below the schedule and Zoom credentials for
placement drive on 17/05/2025 [Saturday].
Also, Kindly revert back with the details required for the interested
candidates in the attached CSV.



*Welcome to BosLeo Online Placement Drive with CHARUSAT*



*Recruitment Process:*

   - Online Test (consist of Aptitude, Programming & logic questions).
   - Technical Interview.
   - HR Interview.



*Please find below the Schedule/Route Plan of the Placement Drive:*

   - 11.00 AM- 12 PM:       Online test
   - 12.30 PM :                       Result Declaration
   - 3 PM :                                R2 [ Technical Interview ]





*Guidelines:*



   2. *Round 01-Online Test:*

*Required: *Laptop/ Desktop, Chrome Browser , Log in Credentials

   - Online Test consists of Aptitude, Programing & logic questions and
   responds well if opened up on a laptop/Desktop over Chrome browser.
   - Instructions on First page once you enter the login credentials.



*Date & Time*

May 17th 2025   11:00 AM IST

*Test page URL*

https://bosleo.com/candidate

*Username*

provided individually & attached in the form of CSV

*Password*

provided individually & attached in the form of CSV





   3. *Round 2: Technical Interview:*


   - Candidates who qualify for Round 2 [technical Interview]will be
   invited to another Zoom Room for the technical interview round.
   - The date for Round 2 [ Technical Interview] will be decided on the
   basis of no. of shortlisted candidates.







*Note: *The Zoom Room Credentials for Round 2 will be shared only with the
individual shortlisted candidates later.



*Attached**: Excel sheet to be filled and shared back with the details of
interested students. *

subject: Arista network campus
content:
Dear students

kindly find the mail from arista networks for tomorrow's schedule.

========================================================================================================================================================

Good Morning!

Please find attached the student list for the PPT and test tomorrow. I will
share the webinar link for the PPT by EOD today. Please inform the students
to register and connect on the link 5 minutes prior to the start time. The
rest of the schedule will be briefed after the test shortlist.

subject: Submission Reminder for Agumentik Group Interview Task – Deadline Today by 3 PM
snippet: Dear Students, As part of the ongoing interview process with Agumentik Group, you are requested to submit your assigned task using the link provided below. 🔗 Submission Link: Submit Your Task Here 🕒
content:
Dear Students,
As part of the ongoing interview process with Agumentik Group, you are requested to submit your assigned task using the link provided below.
🔗 Submission Link: Submit Your Task Here<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf41Td6Fqh64yAxkVqWz1Om1-2dbKhTejEdEz_JbfwlISHnRA/viewform>
🕒 Deadline: Today, 12th May, by 3:00 PM
Please ignore this mail if you have already submitted your task as shared earlier by Agumentik Group.
[https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/RO-iIdwJS4zxYSThnS2V739rqmCqKFKhUvg8JSp57cRH3MZHzjL9udhYdXCQGsoIduD__yg8LEPqhPk=w1200-h630-p]<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf41Td6Fqh64yAxkVqWz1Om1-2dbKhTejEdEz_JbfwlISHnRA/viewform>
Agumentik Group #Assessment Task Submission Form<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf41Td6Fqh64yAxkVqWz1Om1-2dbKhTejEdEz_JbfwlISHnRA/viewform>
This form is designed to collect responses from students who have participated in the assessment process. Kindly submit your details and task URLs here. Your submission will be reviewed based on the quality, functionality, and completion of the assigned task. 📌 Please ensure that all links are accessible and functional. Only complete and valid submissions will be considered for the next round of selection.
docs.google.com

Nitin Tyagi
Senior Placement Manager
Edunet Foundation

Call/ WhatsApp- 9997090317

subject: Code Unnati- Update on your Application for the Sparks to Ideas
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings from Code Unnati! Thank you for your interest in the Job/Internship opportunity with Sparks to Ideas for the role of Intern - Web Design. We would like to inform you that your
content:
Dear Students,
Greetings from Code Unnati!
Thank you for your interest in the Job/Internship opportunity with Sparks to Ideas for the role of Intern - Web Design.
We would like to inform you that your profile has not been shortlisted for the next round of the interview process. The company has selected candidates whose skills and experience more closely matched their current requirements.
We encourage you to continue exploring other exciting opportunities available on the Code Unnati LMS portal.
Wishing you the very best in your future endeavours.
Best regards,
Code Unnati – Placement Team

subject: University Practical Examination (HS 132.02 Contributory personality development)
snippet: Dear Students, I hope you are doing well! This is to inform you that the University Practical Examination for the course HS 132.02 Contributory personality development for SEMESTER 6 B.Tech is
content:
Dear Students,


I hope you are doing well!

This is to inform you that the University Practical Examination for the
course HS 132.02 Contributory personality development for SEMESTER 6 B.Tech is
scheduled on  7th May 2025*.*


The exam components and schedule are as follows:




*Part-1 Quiz (In the classroom) for 30 marksTiming - 09:20AM - 9:55
AMPart-2 Group Discusion(GD) for 20 marks & Viva for 20 marksTiming – 10:00
AM onwards in parallel tracks*


I've attached the question bank for you to prepare for the practical exam.

*The topics will be shared one day before the GD.*


On the day of your practical exam, you are required to:




*·          Bring your Hall Ticket & I-card·           Wear formal attire·
        Come prepared for Quiz, Viva, and GD *

*The venue for the exam will be shared soon**.*


Feel free to talk to me on 9925059695 if you have any questions about exam
topics or the question bank. It is advisable that you thoroughly refer to
the study material shared with you earlier.




Thank you

*Bharati H. Kaknani*
Assistant Professor
Department of Humanities and Social Sciences (HSS)
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
Ext. No. 5135
Contact No. 9925059695

--

subject: Information: Task and Documentation Process for UI/UX & MERN Stack Shortlisted Students II Agumentik Group
snippet: Dear Students, Agumentik Group has sent an email to all the shortlisted students listed in the attached file for UI/UX and MERN Stack roles only. Please check your email and connect with our HR
content:
Dear Students,

Agumentik Group has sent an email to all the shortlisted students listed in the attached file for UI/UX and MERN Stack roles only.
Please check your email and connect with our HR department via the WhatsApp number provided in the email. The documentation process and task details will be shared through the same WhatsApp number. Specific time slots for each role and student are clearly mentioned in the email.
Please Note:

  *
Tasks will be shared only within the mentioned time slots.
  *
Students shortlisted for other profiles will receive the email by end of day today, and they will also need to follow the same process.

Deadline Reminder:
All shortlisted students for UI/UX and MERN Stack roles must connect on the company’s WhatsApp number by today, before 4 PM.
Please ensure timely action to avoid missing further instructions.

​Unfeigned Regards,

Nitin Tyagi
Senior Placement Manager
Edunet Foundation
Call/ WhatsApp- 9997090317
LinkedIn- linkedin.com/in/nitin-tyagi-60263aba/<http://linkedin.com/in/nitin-tyagi-60263aba/>
Website- https://www.edunetfoundation.org/

P   Before printing, think about the environment, every 3000 A4 paper costs 1 tree. Please DO NOT print unless you really need it.

subject: Important & Urgent: Edunet Foundation || Video Submission Guidelines for Agumentik Group Recruitment Process
snippet: Dear Students, Thank you for expressing your interest in the Agumentik Group. As part of the next phase of the recruitment process, the company requires you to submit a short video. Please create a
content:
Dear Students,

Thank you for expressing your interest in the Agumentik Group. As part of the next phase of the recruitment process, the company requires you to submit a short video.

Please create a video (minimum 30 seconds) on YouTube that includes the following elements:

A brief self-introduction


  *
Your desired role (please choose only one role per applicant)
  *
Relevant skills related to the chosen role
  *
How you can contribute to Agumentik Group
  *
Once your video is created, kindly share the video URL (YouTube or LinkedIn) with us.
  *
Invalid or inaccessible links= no consideration

Deadline for submission: 24th April by 5:00 PM

Video submission link- https://forms.gle/NUj4wm84NidaQYJz8

For any queries, please reach out to  Nitin Tyagi At 9997090317

We look forward to your submissions.



Thank you & Regards,

Upasana Maurya

Student Success Manager

| upasana@edunetfoundation.org

[cid:31f9080f-f96f-4a4b-93fa-fa7998654287]

Edunet Foundation

Gurgaon/NCR office : A-11-1105, Arcadia,South City 2,

Gurgaon 122018, India

subject: Summer Internship – Python, Web, and AI/ML Development Roles at Fincept.in
snippet: Dear, I hope you're doing well. I'm Tilak Patel, founder of Fincept.in – a fintech platform focused on financial literacy, investment tools, market analysis, and real-time data products. We are
content:
Dear,

I hope you're doing well.

I’m Tilak Patel, founder of Fincept.in – a fintech platform focused on financial literacy, investment tools, market analysis, and real-time data products. We are currently working across multiple platforms, and we’re offering summer internship roles for selected students to contribute to our live projects.

Open Positions:

📌 Python Developer (Backend & Terminal)
Contribute to Fincept Terminal, our command-line financial research tool built using Python and Textual. Responsibilities include backend feature development, data pipeline integration, and financial data handling. Product you will be working on :- https://github.com/Fincept-Corporation/FinceptTerminal/ 

📌 Web Developer (PHP/MySQL)
Work on Fincept Markets, Fincept News, and Fincept Product. Tasks involve dashboard development, backend APIs, and UI components using PHP, HTML/CSS, and Bootstrap.

📌 AI/ML Intern (Python/C++)
Projects involve:
- Document parsing for structured financial insights
- Object detection from satellite and street view imagery
- Satellite data collection and custom dataset creation for AI training
- Experimental work in financial forecasting and model building

📝 Internship Details:
- Type: Summer Internship
- Duration: ~1 months
- Mode: Remote
- Stipend: Unpaid
- Perks: Certificate of Internship (Digital) , Letter of Recommendation (Performance-based), Offer Letter (Digital)

Looking forward to working closely with the selected students on these exciting and impactful projects.

Best regards,  
Tilak Patel  
Founder – Fincept.in  
📧 tlkindustriespvtltd@gmail.com  
📞 +91-6355440147  
🌐 https://fincept.in

subject: Internship Conformation
snippet: Dear Student, Congrats, We are pleased to inform you that your engagement as an intern in our company AGEVOLE INNOVATION PVT. LTD. has been approved. The terms of your internship with the company will
content:
Dear Student,

Congrats, We are pleased to inform you that your engagement as an intern 
in our company AGEVOLE INNOVATION PVT. LTD. has been approved. The terms 
of your internship with the company will be as follows:

  	* Internship period will be from 12-05-2025 to 28-06-2025 _(1.5 
Months)_.
  	* Mode options include Online and Offline (Head Office in Surat, 
Gujarat).
  	* Your performance will be evaluated from time to time and the same 
will be reflected in your internship completion certificate.
  	* If you leave the internship halfway through, you will not receive an 
internship completion certificate.
  	* There is a registration fee of Rs.500.
  	* You have to fill hereby attached internship agreement and submit it 
on this mail ID as reply of this mail.
  	* After signing the agreement you will be provided an offer letter to 
start the journey of internship. But you cannot leave the internship 
halfway if you did you will not get certificate.
  	* Goodies and Premium Intern Kit are provided.

The confirmation letter for your internship will be handed over to you 
once you confirm your acceptance of the above terms by 10-04-2025 and 
communicate your decision to start the internship with our company.

Please note that if you have already sent the Agreement letter, kindly 
disregard this message and proceed with filling out the Google form 
after payment. Payment details are available within the form. However, 
if you have not yet sent the Agreement letter, then sent us and then do 
the form submission process.

We're delighted to have you onboard for the internship! To ensure we 
have all your details accurately, kindly fill out this form: Google Form 
Link [1]. Your prompt response would be appreciated.

Due to recent cancellations, we're implementing a compulsory 
registration fee for all interns. Please pay promptly to continue. 
Update the Google form after payment. Also Noted that from that Goodies 
and Premium Intern Kit are provided.

Looking forward to a productive collaboration!
Please do not hesitate to contact us.

Email: internship@agevole.in
Contact No: +91 75671 83505 [2]
Website: https://agevole.in/contact

Links:
------
[1] https://forms.gle/grPSwovXd1pakKgy5
[2] tel:9408617250

content:
Thank you for applying for the *Summer Internship at Crown* through the
Google Form shared by *Ashwin Makwana* or *Aayushi Ma’am*. We appreciate
your interest!

To ensure accurate record-keeping, we have created a *new Google Form* where
you need to select the applicable fields correctly. Please complete this
form to confirm your internship application:

������ *https://forms.gle/xmtyqn5RK5xgWtxR8
<https://forms.gle/xmtyqn5RK5xgWtxR8>*
Important Notes:

   -

   *7th-semester students* can also opt for a *6-month or 12-month
   internship* instead of just the summer internship.
   -

   The *6-month and 12-month options will not be available later if applied
   for 1.5 month*, so if interested, apply now only (Extension or new
   application option will not be provided later).
   -

   *Once applied for any period, you cannot shorten your internship
   duration.*

Please submit the form at the earliest to proceed with the next steps. Let
us know if you have any questions.

Best regards,
CROWN Software

Vansh Muchhala BBA UG 1st CHARUSAT*Program Overview:*

*First Month: Training*

   - Participate in live lectures and receive guidance from industry
   professionals.
   - You will receive login details after the Registration Process.

*Second Month: Internship*

   - Engage in real-world projects with professional mentorship.
   - *Project Details:*
      - *Individual Assignments:* Complete 10 unique projects with your
      mentor.
      - *Group Capstone Project:* Collaborate in teams on a capstone
      project, with specific roles assigned to each intern. All necessary
      resources will be provided by the company.

*Class Formats:*

   1. *Blended Learning:*
      - Access recorded sessions and join live doubt-clearing sessions
      every weekend.
   2. *Live Mentor-led Classes:*
      - Attend live Zoom sessions 2-3 times per week after 6:30 PM, with
      recorded sessions available for later review. You will also have
access to
      our Learning Management System (LMS) for six months.

*Certificates and Benefits:*

Upon completion, students will receive:

   - A *Certificate of Completion* in alliance with LaunchEd [NSDC]
   - Verified certificates through *Wipro Dice ID*.
   - A *Co-branded Internship Certificate* from leading MNCs.
   - *100% Placement Assistance* and entry to a growing professional
   network.
   - Training on *Low-Code and No-Code Tools*.
   - Curriculum focused on *Generative AI and Prompt Engineering*.
   - Exclusive *Masterclasses* with industry leaders.
   - Personalized mentorship for tailored guidance.



*Don’t miss out on this valuable opportunity!*
*Interested students should submit their applications to be part of this
transformative experience.*


Submit your Application
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeAZ7w57C483zdidyyDWu8KwgdbTHurWd9dRNL5aQME0ONcpQ/viewform?usp=header>



*Best regards,*

*AKASH KAPOOR*
*Senior Academic **Counselor*

>>> Greetings from the Department of Information Technology - DEPSTAR - FTE,
>>> CHARUSAT!

>>> for our esteemed resource person, Mr. Bhavesh Shah, the dates for the *Endowment
>>> Chair Activity on Cloud Computing* have been rescheduled. The event
>>> will now take place on *8th and 9th March 2025*.
>>>
>>> We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this change may cause and
>>> appreciate your understanding.
>>>
>>> This event is a unique opportunity to delve into the world of Cloud
>>> Computing through the *AWS Technical Deep Dive Workshop*. Participants
>>> will gain invaluable knowledge and practical experience with key AWS
>>> services, enabling them to deploy a highly scalable and fault-tolerant web
>>> application.

>>>
>>>    - *Fundamentals of Cloud Computing* and Getting Started with AWS
>>>    - AWS Account Security and Virtual Networks
>>>    - Compute and Database Services on AWS
>>>    - Understanding Various Storage Services on AWS
>>>    - Infrastructure Monitoring and Event Notification
>>>    - Implementing High-Availability and Auto-Scaling
>>>

>>>
>>>    - An active AWS account
>>>    - A laptop with internet connectivity
>>>    - An SSH tool like PuTTY installed on your laptop
>>>    - A MySQL client such as Workbench
>>>

>>> Cloud Practice Lead at Intuitive Cloud, who brings over 15 years of IT
>>> experience and expertise in cloud migration, presales, and solution
>>> architecture.
>>>
>>> We encourage all faculty members, research scholars, and students to
>>> participate in this enriching academic activity and make the most of this
>>> learning opportunity.
>>>
>>> Looking forward to your enthusiastic participation!
>>>
>>>
>>> --

>>> Charotar University of Science and Technology

Dear students,

*As your registration, please join the session on time at 2:15 PM using
link below:*

https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19%3aNDTfAInuVtVVGyA_NnKdtmYrcF9VhapTeSYZNfRBbQQ1%40thread.tacv2/1741420816982?context=%7b%22Tid%22%3a%228dbd2884-120c-413b-80b2-1117dd3469a4%22%2c%22Oid%22%3a%225e58dc5d-1578-4969-b8aa-41f2a0e148ab%22%7d

Thanks. Regards

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Martin Parmar <martinparmar.ce@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Mar 7, 2025 at 4:21 PM
Subject: Alumni Success Story: Career Guidance & Skill Building
To: <22ce@charusat.edu.in>, <23ce@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head CE CHARUSAT <hod.ce@charusat.ac.in>, CE <ce@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

I hope this email finds you in good health. We are excited to announce an
upcoming *Alumni Success Story: Career Guidance & Skill Building. *This talk is
part of a distinguished alumni talk series designed to offer numerous
benefits, including:

   - *Career Guidance and Development*
   - *Showcasing Success Stories*

The talk is jointly organized by the U & P U. Patel Department of Computer
Engineering and the CSPIT-Alumni Association (CAA) to focus on *"Alumni Success
Story: Career Guidance & Skill Building."*

*Distinguished Speaker:*

   - *Mr. Jimish Bhayani* – Senior SDE at Amazon | Ex-Salesforce |
   Ex-Microsoft
   - Alumni: CSPIT-CE (Formerly known CITC) 2011 pass  out batch.

The session will be online using MS Team.

*Event Details:*

   - *Date:* Saturday, 8th  March 2025
   - *Time:* 2:30 PM onwards
   - *Location:* MS Team

We look forward to your active participation in this Alumni Talk Series and
hope it proves to be a significant step in your academic and professional
growth.

Please confirm your attendance using the link below.

*Registration Link <https://forms.gle/FpfKwpsY463UQBh29>*

*Please find attached profiles of our esteemed alumni and event poster.*

*With best wishes *
-- 

*Martin K Parmar,*

Assistant Professor,
U & PU. Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT),

At. & Post Changa-388421, Ta: Petlad, Dist:Anand, (Gujarat) India.

https://www.linkedin.com/in/martinparmar/

Mob: +91 8488065457

Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT),

content:
Dear All,

*The venue for the Endowment Chair Activity is 329 Seminar Hall, Second
Floor, DEPSTAR, CHARUSAT. Please report at the venue by 9:15 AM tomorrow.*

*Pre-requisites for Hands-On Labs:*

   - An active AWS account
   - A laptop with internet connectivity
   - An SSH tool like PuTTY installed on your laptop
   - A MySQL client such as Workbench

We encourage all participants to join us. For further updates and details
regarding the event, kindly join the dedicated WhatsApp group using the
following link:

https://chat.whatsapp.com/B9Bj9mR03QF0jgZpMUHftX

Please ensure you come prepared with the above requirements to make the
most of the session. Looking forward to seeing you all tomorrow!

subject: Update on Endowment Chair Activity- Department Of Information Technology -DEPSTAR -FTE, CHARUSAT: Revised Dates
snippet: Dear Students, Greetings from the Department of Information Technology - DEPSTAR - FTE, CHARUSAT! We regret to inform you that, due to an unforeseen work-related urgency for our esteemed resource
content:
*Dear Students,*

Greetings from the Department of Information Technology - DEPSTAR - FTE,
CHARUSAT!

We regret to inform you that, due to an unforeseen work-related urgency for
our esteemed resource person, Mr. Bhavesh Shah, the dates for the *Endowment
Chair Activity on Cloud Computing* have been rescheduled. The event will
now take place on *8th and 9th March 2025*.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this change may cause and
appreciate your understanding.

This event is a unique opportunity to delve into the world of Cloud
Computing through the *AWS Technical Deep Dive Workshop*. Participants will
gain invaluable knowledge and practical experience with key AWS services,
enabling them to deploy a highly scalable and fault-tolerant web
application.
Topics to be covered:

   - *Fundamentals of Cloud Computing* and Getting Started with AWS
   - AWS Account Security and Virtual Networks
   - Compute and Database Services on AWS
   - Understanding Various Storage Services on AWS
   - Infrastructure Monitoring and Event Notification
   - Implementing High-Availability and Auto-Scaling

Pre-requisites for Hands-On Labs:

   - An active AWS account
   - A laptop with internet connectivity
   - An SSH tool like PuTTY installed on your laptop
   - A MySQL client such as Workbench

This endowment chair activity will be facilitated by *Mr. Bhavesh Shah*,
Cloud Practice Lead at Intuitive Cloud, who brings over 15 years of IT
experience and expertise in cloud migration, presales, and solution
architecture.

We encourage all faculty members, research scholars, and students to
participate in this enriching academic activity and make the most of this
learning opportunity.

Looking forward to your enthusiastic participation!


-- 
Best Regards,
Chintal Upendra Raval,
Assistant Professor,
Department of Information Technology
Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research
Charotar University of Science and Technology

--

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Premal Patel <premalpatel.dce@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Feb 21, 2025 at 11:52 AM
Subject: Expert session on "Web Application Security: Identifying and
Mitigating Vulnerabilities" on 1st March 2025 (Saturday)
To: <23dce@charusat.edu.in>, <24dce@charusat.edu.in>, <22dce@charusat.edu.in>,
<21dce@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head CE Depstar <hod.ceds@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Depstar <
hodds@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), FTE,
CHARUSAT has organized a talk on *"Web Application Security: Identifying
and Mitigating Vulnerabilities"*  with an objective to equip students with
skills to secure web applications from various kinds of vulnerabilities.

The expert of the talk is* Mr. Gatin Shah, Application Security Specialist,
UBS, Pune.*

You may refer to his profile on: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gatinshah/

The session will be held online, and registered participants will receive a
joining link ahead of the scheduled talk.

*Event Details:*

    Day & Date: Saturday, March 01, 2025
    Time: 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM

To register, please click on the following link:
https://forms.gle/zuYfbpV8rEJF8z8r8

We encourage all domain interested participants to register and get ready
to dive into this rapidly evolving domain.

Registration is open till February 26,2025

For any queries, please feel free to contact:
1. Dr. Premal Patel: +919925198251 | premalpatel.dce@charusat.ac.in
2. Dr. Khushi Patel: +917698617608 | khushipatel.ce@charusat.ac.in

-- 
*Thanks & Regards,*
*Dr. Premal J. Patel,*
*Assistant Professor,*
*DEPSTAR (CE).*

subject: Re: Code Unnati for D2D 5th semester placement interested students
snippet: Dear Students, Hope you're all doing well! I'm excited to announce that we have a session tomorrow from 9:30 AM on SAP ABAP. This session is designed to take your understanding to the next
content:
Dear Students,

Hope you're all doing well!
I'm excited to announce that we have a session tomorrow from 9:30 AM on SAP
ABAP. This session is designed to take your understanding to the next level.
Your presence is highly encouraged! See you all tomorrow with enthusiasm
and energy.
We have mid assessment in afternoon 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM. for those who were
absent during first mid assessment and those who are added after 2nd
workshop.

It is compulsory for all of above concerned students to remain present.

After this no one will entertained further.

Happy Learning.!

subject: Fwd: Expert session on "Web Application Security: Identifying and Mitigating Vulnerabilities" on 1st March 2025 (Saturday)
snippet: Subject: Confirmation: Expert Session Registration Dear Student, Thank you for registering for the Expert session on "Web Application Security: Identifying and Mitigating Vulnerabilities"
content:
*Subject:* Confirmation: Expert Session Registration

Dear Student,

Thank you for registering for the Expert session on "Web Application
Security: Identifying and Mitigating Vulnerabilities"

*Session Details:*
📅 *Date:* 1st March 2025
⏰ *Reporting Time:* 01:55 PM
📍 *Mode:* Online-Teams. The Session will be provided tomorrow.

*Note:* Attendance is mandatory for all registered students.

We look forward to your participation!

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Premal Patel <premalpatel.dce@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Fri, Feb 21, 2025 at 11:52 AM
Subject: Expert session on "Web Application Security: Identifying and
Mitigating Vulnerabilities" on 1st March 2025 (Saturday)
To: <23dce@charusat.edu.in>, <24dce@charusat.edu.in>, <22dce@charusat.edu.in>,
<21dce@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head CE Depstar <hod.ceds@charusat.ac.in>, HOD Depstar <
hodds@charusat.ac.in>


Dear All,

Devang Patel Institute of Advance Technology and Research (DEPSTAR), FTE,
CHARUSAT has organized a talk on *"Web Application Security: Identifying
and Mitigating Vulnerabilities"*  with an objective to equip students with
skills to secure web applications from various kinds of vulnerabilities.

The expert of the talk is* Mr. Gatin Shah, Application Security Specialist,
UBS, Pune.*

You may refer to his profile on: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gatinshah/

The session will be held online, and registered participants will receive a
joining link ahead of the scheduled talk.

*Event Details:*

    Day & Date: Saturday, March 01, 2025
    Time: 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM

To register, please click on the following link:
https://forms.gle/zuYfbpV8rEJF8z8r8

We encourage all domain interested participants to register and get ready
to dive into this rapidly evolving domain.

Registration is open till February 26,2025

For any queries, please feel free to contact:
1. Dr. Premal Patel: +919925198251 | premalpatel.dce@charusat.ac.in
2. Dr. Khushi Patel: +917698617608 | khushipatel.ce@charusat.ac.in

-- 
*Thanks & Regards,*
*Dr. Premal J. Patel,*
*Assistant Professor,*
*DEPSTAR (CE).*

www.charusat.ac.in


-- 
*Thanks & Regards,*
*Dr. Premal J. Patel,*
*Assistant Professor,*
*DEPSTAR (CE).*

www.charusat.ac.in

--

content:
Dear Students,

Thank you for joining the session.

Please fill in the following form to indicate the role you are interested in. Going forward, the company will only consider the students who fill in this form by 9pm tonight.

Form Link: https://forms.gle/hhRTHL4kbcdM6YM7A

Best Wishes,

Digbijoy Sarkar
Placement Manager
+91 8347 002 137, dsarkar@edunetfoundation.org

[Edunet-Foundation-GPTW-logo.png]
Edunet Foundation
Gurgaon/NCR office : 901 (9th floor) - Unitech Commercial Tower II - Sector 45 ,
Greenwood City Gurugram Haryana 122003
Bangalore office : Fairway Business Park, 7th Floor, EGL,
Domlur, Bangalore 560071, India
________________________________
From: Digbijoy Sarkar <dsarkar@edunetfoundation.org>
Sent: 19 February 2025 16:22
To: Digbijoy Sarkar <dsarkar@edunetfoundation.org>
Subject: Re: Bitsware Pre-Placement Talk || 19 Feb 4.30pm

Good Afternoon Students,

Bitsware Ahmedabad has scheduled the Pre-Placement talk today (19 Feb 2025) at 4.30pm.

The HR will inform you about the company and explain the JDs to you.

THE SESSION STARTS AT 4.30PM SHARP. JOIN NOW.

subject: Reminder: Workshop on Docker Foundations: A Practical Guide to Containers
snippet: 🚀 Reminder: Docker Workshop - Prerequisites Dear Participant, The "Docker Foundations: A Practical Guide to Containers" workshop is scheduled for today. To ensure a smooth learning experience
content:
🚀 Reminder: Docker Workshop - Prerequisites

Dear Participant,

The *"Docker Foundations: A Practical Guide to Containers"* workshop is
scheduled for today.

To ensure a smooth learning experience, please complete the following
prerequisites before the session:

   - 🎥 Watch the Introduction to Docker (Video)
   <https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=shared&v=H8Lyj2D_cWo>
   - 📖 Read Docker Commands (Beginner to Advanced)
   <https://dev.to/prodevopsguytech/docker-commands-from-beginner-to-advanced-for-devops-engineers-bb3>
   - 💻 Install Docker on Windows: Installation Guide
   <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WDEdRmTCSs8>

🔗 We will soon provide further details, so stay tuned!

If you have any queries, feel free to contact the AIML Club Team or IEEE
CSPIT SB.

Looking forward to seeing you at the workshop!

Best Regards,
*AIML Club & IEEE CSPIT SB Team*
📅 Date: 15th February, 2025 | ⏰ Time: 6:00 to 8:00 PM | 🖥 Mode: Online

content:
Dear Students,

We are planning 3rd party technical subject preparation for placement
interested students. This will be after your 6th-semester university exam.
Based on your registration the decision will be taken. As we are paying a
good amount to Experts, your sincere choice filling and presence is
required. All of you need to fill up this form *by 4.30 PM.*

subject: Fwd: Mandatory Pre-Placement Preparation Test for 6th Semester Students – 16/12/2024
snippet: ---------- Forwarded message --------- From: D23IT179 CHHATRALA TIRTH SANJAYBHAI <d23it179@charusat.edu.in> Date: Sun, 5 Jan, 2025, 9:47 pm Subject: Fwd: Mandatory Pre-Placement Preparation Test
content:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: D23IT179 CHHATRALA TIRTH SANJAYBHAI <d23it179@charusat.edu.in>
Date: Sun, 5 Jan, 2025, 9:47 pm
Subject: Fwd: Mandatory Pre-Placement Preparation Test for 6th Semester
Students – 16/12/2024
To: <d23ce187@charusat.edu.in>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Sanket Suthar <sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in>
Date: Mon, Nov 25, 2024 at 12:41 PM
Subject: Re: Mandatory Pre-Placement Preparation Test for 6th Semester
Students – 16/12/2024
To: <22it@charusat.edu.in>
Cc: Head IT CHARUSAT <hod.it@charusat.ac.in>, IT <it@charusat.ac.in>


Dear Students,

This is a reminder regarding the *Mandatory Pre-Placement Preparation Test*
scheduled for *6th Semester Students*. The details are as follows:

*Date:* 16th December 2024
*Time:* 09:10 Onwards
*Venue:* Classroom 607,608,609,610

Attendance is *compulsory* for all placement interested students as this
test plays a crucial role in preparing you for upcoming placement
opportunities.

Please ensure you arrive on time and come well prepared.


Dr. Sanket Suthar

Assistant Professor

Faculty Training and Placement Representative

Department of Information Technology | CSPIT | CHARUSAT

Accredited Grade 'A+' by NAAC
[image: mobilePhone] +91 9909147190
[image: emailAddress] sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in
<sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.ion>
[image: address] Charotar University of Science and Technology


On Sat, Nov 16, 2024 at 12:06 PM Sanket Suthar <
sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in> wrote:

> Dear Students,
>
> This is to inform all 6th semester students interested in placements that
> a *Pre-Placement Preparation Test* has been scheduled for *Monday, 16th
> December 2024*, starting from *9:10 AM onwards*. The test will take place
> in the following classrooms physically and will be *MCQ based*:
>
>    - Classroom 607,608,609,610
>
> This is a *mandatory* test for all students who wish to participate in
> the placement process. The test will focus on *technical concepts* and
> will be designed based on the kind of questions typically asked in company
> interviews. To help you prepare, I am attaching relevant study materials
> for your reference.
>
> 1.Programming Languages (C, C++, Java, Python)
>
>    - https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/interview-preparation/
>    - https://www.interviewbit.com/java-interview-questions/
>
> 2. Data Structures and Algorithms
>
>    - https://www.techinterviewhandbook.org/algorithms/study-cheatsheet/
>    -
>    https://www.interviewbit.com/data-structure-interview-questions/?utm_medium=referral&utm_source=https://www.interviewbit.com/java-interview-questions/#freshers
>    -
>    https://www.careerride.com/Data-Structure-Interview-Questions.aspx#google_vignette
>
> 3. Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
>
>    -
>    https://leetcode.com/discuss/interview-question/3828150/oops-cheatsheet-for-interviews-30-questions
>    - https://www.interviewbit.com/oops-interview-questions/
>
> 4. Operating Systems
>
>    - https://www.interviewbit.com/operating-system-interview-questions/
>    - https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/50-operating-system-mcqs-with-answers/
>    - https://www.careerride.com/Operating-System-Interview-Questions.aspx
>    -
>    https://www.careerride.com/Operating-System-Interview-Questions-2.aspx
>
> 5. Database Management Systems (DBMS)
>
>    -
>    https://www.careerride.com/mcq/database-programming-language-mcq-questions-47.aspx
>    - https://www.interviewbit.com/dbms-mcq/
>
> 6. Computer Networks
>
>    - https://www.placementpreparation.io/mcq/computer-network/
>    <https://codered.eccouncil.org/courseVideo/network-defense-essentials>
>    - https://www.mobiprep.com/post/class-notes-cn-computer-networks-basics
>    <https://www.edx.org/course/network-defense-essentials-nde>
>
> 7. Software Engineering
>
>    - https://www.guru99.com/software-engineering-interview-questions.html
>    - https://www.javatpoint.com/software-engineering-interview-questions
>    -
>    https://www.interviewbit.com/software-engineering-interview-questions/
>
> By focusing on these areas, students can build a strong technical base
> that will be valuable for both coding interviews and other
> placement-related assessments.
>
> Please ensure you are well-prepared, as this test will be an important
> part of your placement preparation.
>
>
> Dr. Sanket Suthar
>
> Assistant Professor
>
> Faculty Training and Placement Representative
>
> Department of Information Technology | CSPIT | CHARUSAT
>
> Accredited Grade 'A+' by NAAC
> [image: mobilePhone] +91 9909147190
> [image: emailAddress] sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.in
> <sanketsuthar.it@charusat.ac.ion>
> [image: address] Charotar University of Science and Technology
>

snippet: Hello, We appreciate your participation in Smile Fiesta 2.0. Following is the time schedule and venue of the event. EVENTS TIME VENUE Bollywood Theme Zumba 9am - 10am ARIP GROUND Laughter Session 10am
content:
Hello,

We appreciate your participation in Smile Fiesta 2.0.
Following is the time schedule and venue of the event.

EVENTS TIME VENUE
Bollywood Theme Zumba 9am - 10am ARIP GROUND
Laughter Session 10am - 11 am 1st Floor Seminar Hall,RPCP Building
Pottery Playtime 12pm - 2pm Gazebo beside EC/EE Building
Mini Games 2pm - 4pm Central Lawn

Thanks and Regards,
CSPIT CE, CSE, IT & AIML NSS UNIT.

subject: Re: Inquiry About the "Soil Quality Monitoring Using NPK Sensor" Project
snippet: You can meet me personally.. On Tue, Dec 24, 2024, 2:54 PM Anand Chaniyara <d23ce186@charusat.edu.in> wrote: Dear Sir, I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to inquire about the project
content:
You can meet me personally..

On Tue, Dec 24, 2024, 2:54 PM Anand Chaniyara <d23ce186@charusat.edu.in>
wrote:

> Dear Sir,
>
> I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to inquire about the
> project titled *"Soil Quality Monitoring Using NPK Sensor"* which is
> written as faculty a project under you.
>
> The project caught my attention as it aligns with my personal background,
> being from a farming family. I am curious to learn more about this topic
> and would appreciate it if you could provide an explanation of the
> project's objectives and scope. Additionally, I would like to know what
> knowledge or skills are required to understand or contribute to such a
> project.
>
> Thank you for your time and guidance. I look forward to hearing from you.
> Best Regards
> *Anand Chaniyara (D23CE186)*
> U & P U Patel Department of Computer Engineering,
> Chandubhai S Patel Institute of Technology,
> CHARUSAT, Changa, Anand-388421.

subject: University Practical Examination for the subject HS131.02. A: Communication & Soft Skills
snippet: Dear Students, This is to inform you that your third-year B.Tech University Practical Examination for the subject HS131.02. A: Communication & Soft Skills is scheduled for November 23, 2024. Please
content:
Dear Students,

This is to inform you that your third-year B.Tech University Practical
Examination for the subject HS131.02. A: Communication & Soft Skills is
scheduled for *November 23, 2024*. Please review the components and
instructions for the examination below:
Examination Components:

   1. *Quiz*: 30 Marks (to be conducted in class)
   2. *Viva Voce*: 20 Marks
   3. *Group Discussion*: 20 Marks

You are required to report to the institute by *09:00 AM* on the day of the
examination. *The topics for the **Group Discussion component will be
provided one day before the examination.*
Important Instructions:

   - Formal attire is mandatory.
   - Please bring your *university ID* card and *Hall Ticket,* as they are
   required for the Viva Voce.
   - Refer to all the study material, the topic-wise sample question bank,
   and the practice exercises.
   - The topic for Group Discussion will shared a day before the Exam.

We wish you the best in your preparation. Kindly ensure adherence to all
instructions.

Thank you

*Bharati H. Kaknani*
Assistant Professor
Department of Humanities and Social Sciences (HSS)
Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT)
Ext. No. 5135
Contact No. 9925059695

--

content:

continuous assessment. So you will be evaluated on that basis.

Complete any 5 assignments of the given NPTEL course.

solutions. The submission date will be communicated to you.

subject: Fwd: TEDx CHARUSAT 2024 – Confirmation of Your Attendance! _ September 2024
snippet: Dear Attendee, The countdown is on! 🎉 We're thrilled to remind you that we are a few hours away from TEDxCHARUSAT 2024, and we can't wait to have you with us on September 24th for a day of
content:
Dear Attendee,

The countdown is on! 🎉 We’re thrilled to remind you that we are a *few
hours away* from *TEDxCHARUSAT 2024*, and we can’t wait to have you with us
on *September 24th* for a day of *Ingenious Creations*!


*Here’s What You Need to Know:*

   - *Venue*: CMPICA Building, CHARUSAT Campus
   - *Reporting Time*: 12:00 PM sharp
   - *Theme*: "Ingenious Creations"


*Important Reminders:*

   1. *Dress Code*: White and blue attire is mandatory.
   2. *Verification and ID Collection*: After reaching the venue, please
   verify your registration and collect your TEDx event ID card at the
   reception area. (Central Square, CMPICA Building)
   3. *Attendance Policy*: If you are unable to attend, please inform us in
   advance so we can allocate your seat to another candidate.
   4. *Code of Conduct*:
      - Arrive on time; latecomers may not be allowed entry.
      - Keep mobile phones on silent during the event.
      - Photos and videos are not allowed during the talk.
   5. *Re-entry*: Once the event begins, re-entry will not be permitted
   until breaks.


Prepare yourself for mind-blowing ideas, groundbreaking innovation, and the
chance to connect with fellow change-makers! This will be a day to remember
– and you’re at the heart of it!

We can’t wait to see you there. 💡✨


Best Regards,

*TEDx CHARUSAT 2024 Team*

--

subject: Confirmation of your Participation in Workshop on "Hands-On IoT: Building Smart Devices with Code and Hardware"
snippet: Dear Student, Congratulations! You have been selected to participate in the upcoming workshop. Below are the important details: Date: Saturday, 21st September 2024 Venue: Lab 314, DEPSTAR Building,
content:
Dear Student,

Congratulations! You have been selected to participate in the upcoming
workshop. Below are the important details:

*Date*: Saturday, 21st September 2024
*Venue*: Lab 314, DEPSTAR Building, Second Floor
*Reporting Time*: 9:15 AM

*Please ensure that you attend the workshop as scheduled. You were selected
from 110 registered students on a first-come, first-served basis, so your
attendance is highly encouraged. If you are unable to attend, it would
prevent another student from benefiting from this opportunity.*

*Important Reminder*:
Kindly bring your laptop for the hands-on session, and make sure to
complete the setup outlined in the attached document.

Looking forward to your active participation!

-- 

*Nilesh Kumar Dubey**(PhD)*
Assistant Professor,
Computer Science and Engineering,
Institutional Coordinator of *IQAC*, *CSIC,* *UIIC, IPR*
Devang Patel Institute of Advanced Technology & Research

Changa-388421, Gujarat, INDIA.
http://www.charusat.ac.in

--

subject: AICTE -approved industrial internship for students [cisco & meta certification]
snippet: Dear Students, We are excited to announce an AICTE-approved internship program in collaboration with TNK Cognizance IIT Roorkee. If you're interested, fill out the application below: https://docs.
content:
Dear  Students,

We are excited to announce an *AICTE-approved internship program* in
collaboration with *TNK Cognizance IIT Roorkee*.

If you're interested,  fill out the application below:
*https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScaz1QYoNayJsy4_mks4K9C6M9GSrEM_2STii2pTLvvd2Qjbw/viewform?usp=sf_link*
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScaz1QYoNayJsy4_mks4K9C6M9GSrEM_2STii2pTLvvd2Qjbw/viewform?usp=sf_link>

*About the Program:*
This program provides a *2-month Training + Internship* program, and we
accept a particular* number of students*.

To learn more, join the *WhatsApp group*:
 *https://chat.whatsapp.com/H7cpqMAOakX5TmiwPffBHs*
<https://chat.whatsapp.com/H7cpqMAOakX5TmiwPffBHs>

*Program Overview:*

   - *First Month:* Live lectures delivered by *IIT faculty* and *industry
   professionals*. You will receive login credentials after registration.
   - *Second Month:* Internship with live project mentorship. Gain
   experience solving *real-world problems*.

*Projects:*

   - *Individual Projects:* Each intern will be assigned *10 projects* to
   complete with mentor guidance.
   - *Capstone Project:* A collaborative group project where each intern is
   responsible for specific tasks.

necessary *resources* and *materials* will be provided.

*Learning Options:*

   1. *Blended Program (Recorded Classes):* entrance to recorded sessions
   with weekend *live doubt-clearing sessions*.
   2. *Mentor-Led Program (Live Classes):* *Live classes* via Zoom, *2-3
   days a week* at *6:30 PM*, with visibility to recordings and a *Learning
   Management System (LMS)* for 6 months.

*Upon Completion, You Will Receive:*

   - *Certificate of completion* from Cognizance IIT Roorkee.
   - Verified certificates through *Wipro Dice ID*.
   - *Co-branded internship certificate* from leading MNCs.
   - *Placement support*.
   - Entry to our *growing professional community*.
   - Hands-on experience with *low-code and no-code tools*.
   - Expertise in *Generative AI* and *Prompt Engineering*.
   - *Exclusive Masterclasses* from industry leaders.
   - *Personalized guidance* throughout the program.

We would like to encourage you to take advantage of this unique program.

subject: Regarding Seating Arrangement of AI/ ML Hackathon DoseHack'24
snippet: Dear Students, We are thrilled to invite all registered participants to take part in the first round of the AI/ ML Hackathon, “DoseHack'24,” powered by Meditab Group on the below mentioned schedule
content:
Dear Students,

We are thrilled to invite all registered participants to take part in the
first round of the AI/ ML Hackathon, “DoseHack'24,” powered by Meditab
Group on the below mentioned schedule.

*Date:* 10th August 2024, Tuesday

*Time:* 12 pm to 4 pm

*Duration:* 4 Hours

*Content:*

·         *Programming Test:* Assessing your coding skills.

·         *MCQ Section:* Covering key concepts and theories in AI/ML.

*In the first round, each participant's performance will be evaluated
individually, but the final selection will be based on the group's overall
score.*



*How to Prepare:* We encourage you to review core topics such as
programming, algorithms, problem-solving techniques, and the fundamentals
of machine learning and AI.

*What’s Next:* Successful candidates from this round will move on to the
final stage of the Hackathon, where you will tackle more complex and
practical AI/ML challenges. *The duration for the final round would be 24
hours.*

Kindly find the seating arrangement. All the students are requested to
occupy the seats on time.

We look forward to your enthusiastic participation and wish you the very
best of luck!

--

subject: FY25 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 2nd Sep 2024 Invitation
snippet: FY25 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 2nd Sep 2024 Powered by HackerRank You have been invited to attend the challenge FY25 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship |
content:
FY25 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 2nd Sep 2024 - powered by HackerRank



  
    
      
        
        
          You have been invited to attend the challenge FY25 | Cisco Day - Online Assessment | Summer Internship | 2nd Sep 2024. We wish you all the best!

        
        
      

      

      
        
          
            
              Recommended Browser: Google Chrome v101 or greater
            
          
          
          
            Duration: 90 min
          
          
          
          Start Login Date/Time:
          
            2 Sep 2024 06:00 PM IST
            
            (Asia - Kolkata)
            
          
          
          
          
          End Login Date/Time: 2 Sep 2024 06:30 PM IST
            
            (Asia - Kolkata)
            
          
          
          
            Start Test
          
          You can also use this
          test link
          to access the test
          
          anytime before the test expiry date above.
          Please check date and time in your time zone.
          
          
        
      
    
  


Please note once you begin the test the timer will start and the test cannot be paused. Hence it is highly recommended that you complete the test in one sitting.

In case of power failure or loss of internet connection, the test timer will continue to run even though you might not be attempting it, in such a case please contact us by replying back to this email.

For any technical queries, please refer to https://click.pstmrk.it/3ts/candidatesupport.hackerrank.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Fcategories%2F4402828710675-FAQ/EDcI/e6_3AQ/AQ/6c8327a8-fe59-4d26-860f-a276b8f81b0f/4/t0BJDZrZqg or contact us at https://click.pstmrk.it/3ts/support.hackerrank.com%2Fhc%2Fen-us%2Frequests%2Fnew%3Fticket_form_id%3D360001035834./EDcI/e6_3AQ/AQ/6c8327a8-fe59-4d26-860f-a276b8f81b0f/6/e8cfnHE0co

HackerRank only provides a platform to conduct the tests. It does not schedule or evaluate any hiring tests or conduct interviews for any company. Hence for any of the above requests please contact the company that sent you the invite.

subject: Cisco - Summer Internship | Online Assessment Update
snippet: Dear Candidate, Greetings from Cisco! Congratulations on being shortlisted for Summer Internship Online Assessment. As the next step, you will undergo an Online Assessment. You will receive an email on
content:
[cid:image002.png@01DAFA2A.000BE180]





Dear Candidate,



Greetings from Cisco!



Congratulations on being shortlisted for Summer Internship Online Assessment.



As the next step, you will undergo an Online Assessment. You will receive an email on 30th Aug 2024, with the link to take the assessment on the registered email ID. (Please check your Spam/Junk folder if you do not find it in your inbox.)



You should have a HackerRank account with the same email ID and use it to log in to the test.



Online Assessment Schedule



Date

Start time

End time

Duration

02nd Sep 2024

6:00 PM

7:30PM

90 mins


Please read the instructions carefully before the assessment:

  *   The assessment will consist of coding-based questions; ensure you have a stable internet connection throughout the assessment.
  *   The use of any study material, mobile phones, electronic devices, media, or internet resources is not allowed during the test.
  *   No calculators allowed. Using pen and paper is allowed during the test.
  *   Please ensure that you have a built-in camera and that you are taking the test.
  *   Any sort of copying, plagiarism, moving out of the tab/window, or malpractices will lead to disqualification.
  *   Any unfair means used during the assessment will lead to elimination form the process and further course of action will be taken against student/college.
  *   In case of a power cut or network disconnection, resume/rejoin within 30 minutes, else the test will get automatically submitted.
  *   Test will automatically be submitted after 30 minutes of inactivity on the test screen.
  *   To rejoin the test, use the same email address used to register on HackerRank

Please note: Any requests for changes to the online assessment schedule or reattempts will not be entertained. Please ensure you are available during the above-mentioned time.



All the best



Regards,
India Emerging Talent Recruiting Team



©2024 Cisco and/or its affiliated entities.

subject: Candidate Information form - Summer Internship
snippet: Dear candidate, Greetings from Cisco! This is regarding your referral from a Cisco employee, we require additional information to proceed with your application. Please click here to complete the form,
content:
Dear candidate,

Greetings from Cisco!

This is regarding your referral from a Cisco employee, we require additional information to proceed with your application.

Please click here<https://forms.office.com/r/DwPGKUHZ5B> to complete the form, ensuring that the details provided are accurate and complete. Note that the form should only be submitted once, as it is specifically linked to your application. Therefore, please do not share or forward this link to anyone else.

To ensure your application is processed on time, please submit the form by 28 Aug 2024, 05:00 PM.

Thank you for your prompt response.

Best regards,
Emerging Talent Recruiting - India

subject: Fwd: Regarding DoseHack'24
snippet: Dear Students, The pre test of AI/ML Hackathon DoseHack'24 is postponed. The new date will be communicated soon. Kindly take a note of it. ----------------------------------------------------------
content:
Dear Students,

The pre test of AI/ML Hackathon DoseHack'24 is postponed.

The new date will be communicated soon.

Kindly take a note of it.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Dear Students,

We are thrilled to invite all registered participants to take part in the
first round of the AI/ ML Hackathon, “DoseHack'24,” powered by Meditab
Group on the below mentioned schedule.

*Date:* 29th August 2024, Thursday

*Time:* 12 pm to 4 pm

*Duration:* 4 Hours

*Content:*

·         *Programming Test:* Assessing your coding skills.

·         *MCQ Section:* Covering key concepts and theories in AI/ML.

*In the first round, each participant's performance will be evaluated
individually, but the final selection will be based on the group's overall
score.*



*How to Prepare:* We encourage you to review core topics such as
programming, algorithms, problem-solving techniques, and the fundamentals
of machine learning and AI.

*What’s Next:* Successful candidates from this round will move on to the
final stage of the Hackathon, where you will tackle more complex and
practical AI/ML challenges. *The duration for the final round would be 24
hours.*

The seating arrangement for the first round will be communicated to you
shortly.

We look forward to your enthusiastic participation and wish you the very
best of luck!

--

subject: Regarding Seating Arrangement of AI/ ML Hackathon DoseHack'24
snippet: Dear Students, We are thrilled to invite all registered participants to take part in the first round of the AI/ ML Hackathon, “DoseHack'24,” powered by Meditab Group on the below mentioned schedule
content:
Dear Students,

We are thrilled to invite all registered participants to take part in the
first round of the AI/ ML Hackathon, “DoseHack'24,” powered by Meditab
Group on the below mentioned schedule.

*Date:* 29th August 2024, Thursday

*Time:* 12 pm to 4 pm

*Duration:* 4 Hours

*Content:*

·         *Programming Test:* Assessing your coding skills.

·         *MCQ Section:* Covering key concepts and theories in AI/ML.

*In the first round, each participant's performance will be evaluated
individually, but the final selection will be based on the group's overall
score.*



*How to Prepare:* We encourage you to review core topics such as
programming, algorithms, problem-solving techniques, and the fundamentals
of machine learning and AI.

*What’s Next:* Successful candidates from this round will move on to the
final stage of the Hackathon, where you will tackle more complex and
practical AI/ML challenges. *The duration for the final round would be 24
hours.*

Kindly find the seating arrangement. All the students are requested to
occupy the seats on time.

We look forward to your enthusiastic participation and wish you the very
best of luck!

--

subject: Re: Seeking Guidance
snippet: Sure dear will meet once you resume clg. Till watch atomic habit video from youtube. On Thu, 22 Aug, 2024, 1:01 am Anand Chaniyara, <d23ce186@charusat.edu.in> wrote: Pardon me, sir, I missed the
content:
Sure dear will meet once you resume clg.
Till watch atomic habit video from youtube.

On Thu, 22 Aug, 2024, 1:01 am Anand Chaniyara, <d23ce186@charusat.edu.in>
wrote:

> Pardon me, sir, I missed the time today around 10 am as lectures were
> ongoing. Despite not being from Nadiad or Anand, I would still like to meet
> in person once college resumes regularly, if possible.
>
> Thank you, sir, for your time, consideration, and response.
>
>
> On Wed, 21 Aug, 2024, 06:38 Mrugendra Rahevar, <
> mrugendrarahevar.ce@charusat.ac.in> wrote:
>
>> Dear Anand,
>>
>> Pls call me around 10:00am or you can meet me (If you are in Nadiad or
>> Anand).
>>
>>
>> On Wed, 21 Aug, 2024, 12:47 am Anand Chaniyara, <d23ce186@charusat.edu.in>
>> wrote:
>>
>>> Dear Sir,
>>>
>>> I hope you're enjoying your holidays. My name is Anand Chaniyara, and
>>> I'm currently working on the alumni system. We spoke during the project
>>> discussion, and I’m reaching out for some general and career-related
>>> guidance. I'm not sure what you'll think after reading this, or if I should
>>> even send a message like this, but I’ve decided to try after so many
>>> thoughts. Krenil Sapariya, a childhood friend and former classmate,
>>> recommended that I connect with you for help when I joined this college.
>>> I've hesitated until now because I wasn't sure how to express my concerns.
>>>
>>> My main worry is my future—what will I do, sir? I’m not as strong
>>> academically as others, and this uncertainty is overwhelming. Most people
>>> have already decided on a domain or have other plans for their career after
>>> graduation means already set and safe, except me.
>>>
>>> A bit about my background: I initially aimed for a medical career in
>>> 2019 but struggled with competition and financial constraints. After that,
>>> I joined VPRTP but wasn’t satisfied, as others around me were pursuing MBBS
>>> or studying at top engineering colleges. After a second attempt, COVID and
>>> financial issues forced me to withdraw my BAMS admission from GJAC Anand,
>>> where the fees were the highest among all options. With no other choice at
>>> the time, I opted for a diploma in computer engineering, believing it would
>>> lead to a good career without thinking about whether I would fit in.
>>> Although I wanted to try again for medicine, family and financial
>>> challenges led me to continue with the diploma. I’m not complaining about
>>> my family situation; they’ve given me more than I deserve, and I'm grateful
>>> for that. Thanks to my SSC results, I joined BBIT - GIA, a top diploma
>>> college. I take full responsibility for my choices, as I made them without
>>> much guidance, coming from a farming family. My counselor & professor,
>>> Bharat V. Chawda, whom I contacted again during my 5th semester, encouraged
>>> me to keep going, advising that looking back wouldn’t help and that I would
>>> find my way.
>>> Now, in my pre-final year, nearing graduation, the same question
>>> remains: What will I do?  I might sound ridiculous to ask, "What should I
>>> do?"—how can anyone else decide that for me? But the pressure this question
>>> is creating is becoming too much to handle.
>>>
>>> I know some students may have these concerns, though few express or
>>> discuss them openly. I’ve tried reaching out to friends who currently
>>> around me, but they are living already two generations ahead of me, having
>>> not faced any significant setbacks or constraints. Over time, I’ve seen
>>> others improve, but I feel stuck, with no improvement and no hope in sight.
>>> I am feeling like I am lost. I’ve tried to stay motivated, but I can no
>>> longer ignore reality. While I know we have to keep trying, setbacks have
>>> slowed me down, though I’m trying to regain momentum again. This feels like
>>> my last chance to take action as college placements approach. I don’t want
>>> to rely on luck, which hasn’t been on my side so far. If I miss this
>>> opportunity, I fear I won’t get another, and in addition I’m already late.
>>>
>>> I’m seeking your guidance on my career. Thank you for your time and
>>> consideration.
>>>
>>> Best regards,
>>> Anand Chaniyara D23CE186
>>>
>>

>> or entity to which it is addressed and may contain confidential and/or

snippet: Dear Anand, Pls call me around 10:00am or you can meet me (If you are in Nadiad or Anand). On Wed, 21 Aug, 2024, 12:47 am Anand Chaniyara, <d23ce186@charusat.edu.in> wrote: Dear Sir, I hope you
content:
Dear Anand,

Pls call me around 10:00am or you can meet me (If you are in Nadiad or
Anand).


On Wed, 21 Aug, 2024, 12:47 am Anand Chaniyara, <d23ce186@charusat.edu.in>
wrote:

> Dear Sir,
>
> I hope you're enjoying your holidays. My name is Anand Chaniyara, and I'm
> currently working on the alumni system. We spoke during the project
> discussion, and I’m reaching out for some general and career-related
> guidance. I'm not sure what you'll think after reading this, or if I should
> even send a message like this, but I’ve decided to try after so many
> thoughts. Krenil Sapariya, a childhood friend and former classmate,
> recommended that I connect with you for help when I joined this college.
> I've hesitated until now because I wasn't sure how to express my concerns.
>
> My main worry is my future—what will I do, sir? I’m not as strong
> academically as others, and this uncertainty is overwhelming. Most people
> have already decided on a domain or have other plans for their career after
> graduation means already set and safe, except me.
>
> A bit about my background: I initially aimed for a medical career in 2019
> but struggled with competition and financial constraints. After that, I
> joined VPRTP but wasn’t satisfied, as others around me were pursuing MBBS
> or studying at top engineering colleges. After a second attempt, COVID and
> financial issues forced me to withdraw my BAMS admission from GJAC Anand,
> where the fees were the highest among all options. With no other choice at
> the time, I opted for a diploma in computer engineering, believing it would
> lead to a good career without thinking about whether I would fit in.
> Although I wanted to try again for medicine, family and financial
> challenges led me to continue with the diploma. I’m not complaining about
> my family situation; they’ve given me more than I deserve, and I'm grateful
> for that. Thanks to my SSC results, I joined BBIT - GIA, a top diploma
> college. I take full responsibility for my choices, as I made them without
> much guidance, coming from a farming family. My counselor & professor,
> Bharat V. Chawda, whom I contacted again during my 5th semester, encouraged
> me to keep going, advising that looking back wouldn’t help and that I would
> find my way.
> Now, in my pre-final year, nearing graduation, the same question remains:
> What will I do?  I might sound ridiculous to ask, "What should I do?"—how
> can anyone else decide that for me? But the pressure this question is
> creating is becoming too much to handle.
>
> I know some students may have these concerns, though few express or
> discuss them openly. I’ve tried reaching out to friends who currently
> around me, but they are living already two generations ahead of me, having
> not faced any significant setbacks or constraints. Over time, I’ve seen
> others improve, but I feel stuck, with no improvement and no hope in sight.
> I am feeling like I am lost. I’ve tried to stay motivated, but I can no
> longer ignore reality. While I know we have to keep trying, setbacks have
> slowed me down, though I’m trying to regain momentum again. This feels like
> my last chance to take action as college placements approach. I don’t want
> to rely on luck, which hasn’t been on my side so far. If I miss this
> opportunity, I fear I won’t get another, and in addition I’m already late.
>
> I’m seeking your guidance on my career. Thank you for your time and
> consideration.
>
> Best regards,
> Anand Chaniyara D23CE186
>

--

subject: Fwd: Registration fees for Cloud Practitioner New Batch
snippet: Greetings of the day..!! You need to pay your registration fees Rs. 1500(including Tax) at the Account Section. Go to the account section (Admin building) and provide these Information 1. Your ID No. :
content:
Greetings of the day..!!

You need to pay your registration fees *Rs. 1500(including Tax) at the
Account Section. *

Go to the *account section* (Admin building) and provide these Information

*1. Your ID No. : D21IT170 (for example) Provide your ID number first *
*2. Course Name : AWS-ACADEMY *
*3. Batch Name:  AWS-CP-2024-2025-SBS-RVP*

Once you complete your registration process you can continue your classes
held every Saturday.

Next Date of Academy: *10 August (Saturday).*
Location: 628A Lab, CSPIT-IT, A7 Building
Time : 12:30 PM

Note : Ignore if you have already done.


With Regards,

Sanket Suthar,
Assistant Professor, Ph.D., AWS Cloud club lead
Faculty Training and Placement Representative

subject: Re: Industry Visit @ Pune Registration
snippet: Dear students, Please find the attached Industry Tour Policy. Submit a hard copy signed by your parents on August 30th at 1:10 pm in classroom 624. Be present in the meeting on Friday 9th August at 1:
content:
Dear students,

Please find the attached Industry Tour Policy. Submit a hard copy signed by
your parents on August 30th at 1:10 pm in classroom 624.

Be present in the meeting on Friday 9th August at 1:10 pm in classroom 624.

Regards.

On Mon, Jul 8, 2024 at 9:42 PM Martin Parmar <martinparmar.ce@charusat.ac.in>
wrote:

> Dear students,
>
>
>
> The department has organized an industry visit *at Pune, on 13th
> September - 14th September 2024.* Check the attachment for details day
> wise schedule.
>
>
>
> *Brief Info:*
>
>    1. There will be two companies to visit.
>    2. Total payable cost is Rs. 3000/-(per student) including
>    transportations (AC Push-Back Coach), logistics(Triple sharing basis)
>    and breakfast, lunch and dinner.
>
> *Note:* As per the CHARUSAT policy, 50% cost will be spent by the
> University and the remaining 50% needs to be paid by students. You need to
> pay 3000/-.
>
>
>
> *Only Interested students need to complete this registration process on or
> before 9th July 12:00 pm.*
>
>
>
> *No further request will be accepted after the given deadline.*
>
>
> *Looking at the availability of visits to industry and further management,
> only the first 50 students can be considered for the visit.*
>
>

> come first serve basis.*
>
>

subject: Project Reporting website testing on 5th semester SGP
snippet: Dear faculty members. We have developed an "8th semester Reporting" website. This will be useful to us during 8th semester reporting and we can reduce the use of files in this and track the
content:
Dear faculty members.

We have developed an "8th semester Reporting" website. This will be useful
to us during 8th semester reporting and we can reduce the use of files in
this and track the student progress.

To test the system the 5th semester SGP project guide allocation sheet we
are using and based on that the attached sheet is prepared.

The weeks for evaluation are as follows. We are testing for 6 weeks and
reducing the duration as well. After the end date of that week, students
can not submit the report. You can skip the first week report which is also
part of the testing. Every week you need to upload one pdf which shows your
work and for that faculty will give you marks.

week_no start_date end_date
1 2024/07/28 2024/08/02
2 2024/08/01 2024/08/06
3 2024/08/04 2024/08/10
4 2024/08/08 2024/08/14
5 2024/08/12 2024/08/18
6 2024/08/16 2024/08/22

How to use the system:
Video Link: Student Demo
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Fa_Zt2qrcm6kwjzOxc5xxfGblal-0Tya/view?usp=sharing>

The website link is: http://172.16.11.106/auth/login   (Available from
CHARUSAT campus)
User Name: student ID
Password: FirstName and Student ID (Ex. RONAK PATEL, 22CE094 then password
is RONAK22CE094  (Change password after first login)

whenever you face any issue kindly fill up below google form:
Form Link: https://forms.gle/h73UibT9xwcBxfFZA

Thank You for your support.

-- 
Ronak N. Patel
Assistant Professor, Representative-Career Development and Placement Cell

subject: Re: Registration fees for Cloud Practitioner New Batch
snippet: Dear All, This is a gentle reminder for registration fee payment for a new batch starting from Tomorrow ( 03/08/20240 Those who have already completed the registration are informed to come with your
content:
Dear All,

This is a gentle reminder for registration fee payment for a new batch
starting from Tomorrow ( 03/08/20240
Those who have already completed the registration are informed to come with
your softcopy of payment receipt received from the Account section.
I am very excited to see you all registered students in the Academy
tomorrow.

Starting Date of Academy: *3rd August 2024(Saturday).*
Location: 614A Lab, CSPIT-IT, A7 Building
Time: 10:00 AM Onwards

We will close the registration process soon as we have a limited number of
seats available.

Thank you.


With Regards,

Sanket Suthar,
Assistant Professor, Ph.D., AWS Cloud club lead
Faculty Training and Placement Representative
Smt. K.D.Patel Department of Information Technology,
Charotar University of Science & Technology.(CHARUSAT)
*Accredited Grade 'A+' by NAAC & KCG*
(M)+91-9909147190

*!!!Go Green!!!*

Please do not print this e-mail unless necessary

>

> *3. Batch Name:  AWS-CP-2024-2025-SBS-RVP*

> Once you complete your registration process you can continue your classes

>
> *Note: A total of 107 registrations have been received. The first 50
